metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1704 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Google V8 before 3.23.17.18, as used in Google Chrome before 33.0.1750.149, allow attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have other impact via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1704` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 33.0.1750.152-0ubuntu1~pkg995.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 33.0.1750.152-0ubuntu1~pkg995.1
chromium-chromedriver - 33.0.1750.152-0ubuntu1~pkg995.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 33.0.1750.152-0ubuntu1~pkg995.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 33.0.1750.152-0ubuntu1~pkg995.1
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.0.0~bzr452-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.0.0~bzr452-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.0.0~bzr452-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.0.0~bzr452-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.0.0~bzr452-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '33.0.1750.152-0ubuntu1~pkg995.1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
oxide-qt package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.0~bzr452-0ubuntu1').
